item.title: Family of Science
item.description: The Bohr Family Niels Bohr was a great practitioner of the Scientific method and inspired many physicists throughout his career such as Werner Heisenberg, Lev Landau, Wolfgang Pauli, Paul Dirac, just to name a few and undoubtedly continues to do so. But his motivations and influential contributions are resonated in his own family as well. This image that I came across a few days ago, tugged at my conscience and made me realize something truly extraordinary.

item.title: Great Minds
item.description: Fifth conference participants, 1927. Institut International de Physique Solvay in Leopold Park The great minds of the nineteenth-century meeting for the Nobel Committee meeting. This picture was taken by Benjamin Couprie at the Institute International de Physique Solvay, Leopold Park, Brussels Belgium. Back row, left to right: Auguste Piccard, Emile Herniot, Paul Ehrenfest, Edouard Herzen, Theophile de Donder, Erwin Schrodinger, Jules-Emile Verschaffelt, Wolfgang Pauli, Werner Heisenberg, Ralph Howard Fowler, Leon Brillouin.

item.title: The Infinite Universe
item.description: I believe that small though we are, insignificant though we may be, the human mind is capable of very very big things indeed. We are capable of reaching a full understanding of our universe and then realize that all we had to do was to look within ourselves.
